content.description: Face climb up kinda crappy rock until you reach it becomes a nice crack. Face climb and jam this crack which has tons of big footholds and great handholds/jams. Eventually it turns into double cracks towards where it begins to overhang in nice rock(barely) at the top.
content.protection:
Gear to 3"

Build Anchor on the Mesa top.
content.location: Past Chockstone gulley this crack is imediately right of "Go cat Go" a bolted route with 9 bolts.

content.description:
Climb Whale of the Wanapum to where it turns to blue Camalot size.  Make an entertaining traverse right to a thin crack just left of the prow.

Belay on top, or use a new (as of spring 2020) bolted anchor right of Whale of the... and lower.  An independent start has been toproped.
content.protection: Pro to 3", with small cams and wires for the finish.
content.location: Between Whale of the Wanapum and Firestarter.

content.description:
Caution! Rock fall 5/25/19. Route needs to be evaluated before climbing again. See comments.

Start by climbing the face up to gain the start of the obvious hand-fist crack. (Micro cams protect going up into the crack)

Climb up the widening crack using jams and plenty of face holds. Numerous rests/stances abound.

The top 4 feet of the crack goes to OW in size.
content.protection:
Cams from Micro to 4 inches.

Belay from the cliff top or clip "Burning Spears' anchor"
content.location: The obvious hand-fist crack directly to your left after exiting the 3rd gulley.

content.description:
Very similar to Bad Moon with the crux passing the bulge down low with a reach to good holds. Thin crimps up higher.

More space between a couple of the bolts then some other Vantage sport climbs.
content.location: right of Bad Moon, left of Burning Spears finger crack.

content.description: Climb over easy rock and a few loose holds to gain the crack. Fire in a cam or two and climb up to the right and gain the next 2 bolts which lead to the anchor.
content.location: Left of Canadian Hand Job. Look pillar face with bolts and a crack in the middle of it.

content.description: Pretty hard compared to other 11b Vantage cracks, except Spinning Mars which I consider 11c, but the grade seems right. Lots of big spider moves to small holds or thin cracks.
content.protection: 4 bolts on lower half, gear to 1 1/2", mostly small cams and offset brass nuts. The anchor hangers are missing, but there are a few crack options up there.
content.location: The Yodameister hand crack is on the left, and the next route to the right has a single bolt - Beats Milkin' Cows.

content.description: bolted route right of hamhocks

Start by climbing the face underneath the hand crack. This face is shared with "firestarter" then climb up through some loose rock to the start of the hand crack. Jam, stem and face climb up this short hand crack to the mesa top.
content.protection:
Gear to 3.5"

Build your own anchor and walk off 3rd gulley. Third gulley is a 15 second walk away.
content.location: Right of "Firestarter" the first bolted line around the corner. Look for the obvious hand crack.

content.description:
Begin by climbing the face between the bolted aretes "Broken Glass" and "Ten Bucks and a Sandwich" to gain a good ledge about 15 feet up. From here climb the crack on the right which begins finger/thin hands sized but widens to fists within a few feet.

Set your belay on top.
content.protection:
Gear to 4"

Mostly 3 inch cams for the fist crack.

Set your Anchor on the Cliff top.
content.location: Obvious fist crack around the corner from "Whale of the Wanapum"

content.description:
Crack to the right of beating cows milk

Watch out for loose rocks! Don’t knock them down onto climbers below,

No anchor, belay at top and walk off

climbs.name: Home of the World Famous Peanut Bar

content.description:
This is a pretty fun mixed climb. Start is bolted, top is finger crack. Very sustained after 3rd bolt, pulling small bulge and gaining crack.

1st time I did this I thought it 10c, I was tired this last time, seemed harder.
content.protection:
I think it was 6 bolts, watch out for razor sharp rock near start.

maybe 3 cams needed, but have a selection from .3-.5 camalot size,or some nuts too.

Good chain anchor.
content.location:
Bum Rush( 10c crack ) is left, Hamhocks ( 5.9 crack )is right

You will see the only chain anchor on the face.

content.description:
Face climb to a nice thin hand crack.

Belay on cliff top.
content.protection:
Gear to 2"

Set your own anchor on the cliff top.
content.location:
In the chockstone gulley. Around the corner left from the 3rd gulley.

This is the 3rd crack in the gulley.

content.description: a few pumpy move on the bottom lead to a crack finish
content.location: to the right of red hot chili peppers

content.description: Climb up following the short crack to a small bulge/roof. Clip the bolt (long sling here)and pull the bulge and stand up on top of it. Climb using both sides of the arete using good incuts, flat edges and smaller holds around the corner(with great feet) up to the chains.
content.location: obvious arete right of Whale of the Wanapum.

content.description:
Face climb up over a few bulges into the main face of the arete, using good positive holds up to the crux right up top. Look around, the hold is there, somewhere.

Pro is 8 bolts. Bring a couple slings for the middle draws as they are around the corner and under bulges.

Location: Right side of the Tomato wall. Left of Red Hot Chili Peppers and Go Cat Go.

Start out by face climbing up to gain the steep thin finger crack.

Ascend this crack using finger jams, face holds and 1 hand jam.
content.protection:
Gear to 2"

But mostly smaller

Ends at a ring anchor.
content.location: Just to the left from gulley 3.

content.description:
This is a crack with some interesting face moves in the lower half.

Be careful to protect where you can, otherwise some spicy moves with ground fall potential. The upper crack has some crux pump out moments so find the rests.
content.protection:
the book calls for gear to 2.5", I did not use anything bigger than #1 camalot, with extra .5, there are a couple of nice constrictions for nuts.

It is  easy to make anchor, maybe the 2.5" cams are for this, a #3 works great, also #2, #1 and walk off, or rap at one of the chain anchors

Now that the unknown new route is right of this you can clip the bolts for the start.
content.location: In the alcove on the right side of Tomato wall. 1st crack right of Canadian, and left of new bolted line.

content.description: Worth doing if you are working through all the routes at the Tomato Wall.
content.location: middle of the wall, out on the point where the trail  horseshoes around. Next bolted line right of Firestarter and left of Pot Lickers.

content.description:
Well worth doing even if the start has some choss.

Be very careful here because pro is dicy, you could hit your belayer, or pull a rock off, Millennium Wall is right below.

Pretty hard for the Vantage grade. I think Jim was climbing hard in the mid 90's

I think this is more like 10d

Some wandering, stemming, opposition to find holds.

Overhanging most of the way with tricky gear placing, nuts work better then cams in some spots.
content.protection:
gear to 2" mostly small cams and small nuts, with 1 bolt.

1 pocket for #2 or #3 Camalot about 15' up, then mostly small cams or nuts.

No anchor. Crack on top for anchor is #.3- #.5 camalot size.
content.location:
right of Shot from the sky.

Look for the solitary bolt.

content.description: The crux is mostly the bulge near the start. Maybe easier for tall people ( 5.9), some reachy moves to good holds. Think opposition and stemming.The upper half goes more crimpy.
content.location: On the left end of the Tomato wall, closer to the 3rd access gully.
